intro: Hapalochilus longilabris, commonly known as the long-lipped orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, fragrant flowers with long, slender petals and a prominent lip. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
